Mark Baker writes...

>WSDL 2.0 and its revised HTTP binding was done *desp=
ite* the "Microsoft
>guys".  It was largely the work of a lone W3C staffer =
with significant
>input and review from David Orchard and myself.  David an=
d I proposed
>other things which were rejected, which would have made it ev=
en better.
>The result is that WSDL 2.0 *can* be used as a forms language o=
f sorts,
>but that capability is so thoroughly buried beneath legacy RPC cr=
ap
that
>I don't know how anybody could make sense of it... Case in point;
=
>
>http://norman.walsh.name/2005/02/24/wsdl

Is there a reference outside o=
f the WSDL 2.0 spec itself that boils down
how to use WSDL 2.0 and SOAP to =
specify just a REST-ful interface?

Also -- what does "forms language" mean=
 in this context?

Thanks,
Patrick
